The task now must be to identify which crops we have planted in which fields

text: There is no swift remedy for a loss so costly. There is only the work ahead of us.
The value of our words diminish because they cannot excavate a reason to mend the open wound of our confusion.
We scramble to understand only after the fact. We listen only after we hear shots fired.
A crop whose harvest cannot feed us anything but the hollow echo of thoughts and prayers.
If all you plant are seeds of cruelty in the fields of ones heart... the only crop you will yield is tragedy.
